task_description: Facing the building to your North-East (approx. 35°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the entire building from base to roof to estimate its height, so I will start by looking up to see the top.
I have seen the top of the building, and now I need to look down to see its base to get a complete view for my height estimation.
I have now seen the top and bottom of the building; I will now reset my view to the center to count the floors and make my final estimation.
I have seen the top and bottom of the building, and it appears to be approximately 8 stories high; assuming a standard floor height of 3 meters, the total height is about 24 meters.
